title: Fix typos in CHANGES.txt and contrib/CHANGES.txt prior to 2.9 release
description:
I noticed a few typos in CHANGES.txt and contrib/CHANGES.txt.  (Once they make it past a release, they're set in stone...)

Will attach a patch shortly.

comments.content:
Once they make it past a release, they're set in stone..

Why?
comments.author: Mark Miller

comments.content: I searched just now, but couldn't find, an email thread I recall on java-dev between Doug Cutting and the RM at that point (several years ago) about modifying past releases' CHANGES.txt entries.  Doug's position, articulated both in that thread (and elsewhere, IIRC), was that people depend on being able to do a diff between CHANGES.txt versions, so once a release was cut, the release notes should never change thereafter.
comments.author: Steve Rowe
